artist: Harriet Bart; Harriet Bart; Philip Gallo
creditline: Gift of the Print and Drawing Council
marks: Signed in pencil, on colophon page: Harriet Bart
medium: Bound volume with photographs, fabric samples; letterpress
text: Garment Registry recalls the toils, sacrifices, and experiences of countless anonymous women who contributed to the development of modern America. Designed by Bart and Minneapolis publisher and printer Philip Gallo, the artist's book juxtaposes prose by well-known women writers--such as Martha Graham, Virginia Woolf, Doris Lessing, Willa Cather, and Collette--with historic photographs, fabric samples, and facsimiles of pages from an unidentified ledger listing the names of anonymous women and the amount of dues each has paid. The effect is a subtle, yet poignant commemoration of the important though often unappreciated role that women have played in American history.
title: Garment Register
